Now (revision 307273) the state of this bug has changed.
On a clean build, in the default application, if you try to edit any page with
KUPU, you immediately get two error message boxes:
Error loading
/default/authoring/test.html?lenya.usecase=kupu&lenya.step=imagedrawerxsl:404
and
Error loading
/default/authoring/test.html?lenya.usecase=kupu&lenya.step=linkrawerxsl:404

When you later try to save the page, you get the following message box:
  Error saving your data.
  Response status: 500.
  Check your server log for more information.
and the Jetty console displays:
"file:/D:/Java/apache/lenya-1.4.x/build/lenya/webapp/lenya/usecases/edit-document.js",
line 53: Can't find method $Proxy18.resolve(string).

Created attachment 16848
patch for 404 errors

This patch fixes the 404 errors (due to an incorrect path in the usecase).

text:
problem is that kupu is the only onboard editor that will work with ie6 iirc...
tinymce is reported to work with ie as well, but unfortunately we can't ship it
by default, and it has issues wrt validation (currently, either bxe or tiny works :)

FCKeditor also works. I have people testing with IE6 and IE7. However, it also
can't be shipped by default. It also has validation errors. I've had to do a few
hacks to get it to work properly and those hacks will break BXE. Having Kupu
work is definitely important.

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
Can we postpone this bug beyond 2.0? I don't know it is much of an issue and it
certainly isn't an easy fix. I haven't tried it in an SSL environment, however,
if the save fails, the content remains under HTTP.

The only problem I see is the user gets a confusing error message. While the
status of 415 is returned by webdav.js, the actual message is by kupueditor.js.
That file only takes the status as part of its input for the error message.
Since it is part of the Kupu project, it isn't something we should be changing. 

If someone objects, change the target back.
